source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Planning Accuracy (2018)

note: Total protein must be at least 95% of target
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Protein Distribution Across Meals (2016)

description: Minimum time between dinner and sleep
note: Dinner should be at least 3 hours before sleep for optimal digestion and sleep quality
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Timing and Sleep Quality (2019)

description: Validation for overlapping meal timing windows
note: Meal timing windows should not overlap, minimum 30 minutes gap
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Timing and Circadian Rhythms (2018)

description: Minimum protein per meal for optimal Muscle Protein Synthesis (MPS)
note: Each meal should contain at least 20-30g protein for optimal MPS. Snacks may be exempt or use lower threshold (15g)
source_reference: ISSN Position Stand: Protein and Exercise (2017)

description: Maximum recommended calories per meal to prevent digestive issues
note: No single meal should exceed 45% of daily calories or 1000 kcal (whichever is lower) to maintain optimal digestion
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Size and Digestive Health (2019)

description: Minimum calories per meal to ensure satisfaction and adequate nutrient provision
note: Each meal should contain at least 200 kcal to be substantial enough for satiety and nutrient adequacy. Snacks may use lower threshold (150 kcal)
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Planning and Satiety (2018)

description: Minimum and maximum duration for meal timing windows
note: Meal timing windows should be between 30 minutes and 2 hours to be practical and reasonable
source_reference: AND Position Paper: Meal Timing and Circadian Rhythms (2018)
